text: Stanley's Dragon is a 1994's British family fantasy TV miniseries on CITV starring Judd Trichter and Mia Fothergill. ==Plot== The film takes place in present-day England. Stanley (Trichter) is an American exchange student who, upon becoming separated from his friends in a cavern, finds an unusual rock. He and his friend Rosie (Fothergill) take it home and wash it, discovering it is actually an egg. Rosie suspects it is a dinosaur egg, but when it hatches, they discover the creature inside is actually a dragon. The dragon grows quickly and they name him "Olly". However, the dragon is appropriated by the local authorities, who put it in a zoo. Suspecting the dragon may be the last of its kind, Stanley endeavours to free it. ==Cast== * Judd Trichter - Stanley Katz * Mia Fothergill - Rosie Bennett * Milton Johns - Mr. Batley * Paul Venables - Henry Driver * Jeremy Nicholas - Mr. Fuller * Carol MacReady - Mrs. Batley * Peter Cellier - Mr. Johnson * David Roper - Inspector Walsh * David Ellison - Sgt. Appleyard * John Horsley as Mr. Little ==Nominations== It was nominated for the British Academy Television Award for Best Children's Programme - Fiction or Entertainment.https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0130282/awards?ref_=tt_awd ==References== == External links == * * Category:1994 British television series debuts Category:1994 British television series endings Category:1990s British children's television series Category:1990s fantasy films Category:ITV children's television shows Category:1990s British television miniseries Category:British fantasy television series Category:British television shows featuring puppetry Category:English-language television shows Category:Television series by ITV Studios Category:Films about dragons Category:Television shows set in England Category:Television shows produced by Central Independent Television
title: Stanley's Dragon
